page.title: 18WATERWORKS, LICHFIELD.
page.content: Sandfields is the Company's oldest Pumping Station having formed part of the original supply scheme authorised by the South Staffordshire Waterworks Act 1853. The Ajacent treatment works were completed in 1927 and in addition to the filtration plant, washwater and sludge disposal facilities, the buildings include the Company's Northern Area Office housing 26 administration and technical staff with responsibility for a workforce of approx. 54 men covering Cannock, Burton, Uttoxeter and outlying areas. The office staff deal with all enquiries from consumers and developers within these areas, and ensure that the supply of potable water is maintained within the needs of the distribution system which requires constant monitoring to enable every consumer to receive an adequate supply of water.
